question: How does parathyroid hormone affect circulating levels of periostin?
ideal_answer: Parathyroid hormone can upregulate periostin levels.

snippets.text: Periostin (Postn) is a matricellular protein preferentially expressed by osteocytes and periosteal osteoblasts in response to mechanical stimulation and parathyroid hormone (PTH).
In addition, periostin mRNA was transiently up-regulated in osteoblasts by PTH.
PTH stimulated periostin and inhibited MEF2C and sclerostin (Sost) expression in bone and osteoblasts in vitro.
periostin is a collagen associated bone matrix protein regulated by parathyroid hormone
